name: The Weasleys in Book 6 Quiz | The Weasleys | 15 Questions

questions.text: Which Weasley is missing from Book 6?
questions.explanation:
Charlie.

	Perhaps Charlie is at Dumbledore's funeral, but Harry does not point him out to the reader. Percy turns up twice, in Rufus Scrimgeour's company.

questions.text: What does Mr. Weasley call his wife when they are alone together?
questions.explanation:
Mollywobbles.

	This embarrassing term of endearment is the password at the Weasley residence.

questions.text: Why does Ginny call Fleur Delacour "Phlegm"?
options: because Ginny doesn't want Bill to marry Fleur
questions.explanation:
for all of these reasons.

	Ginny, Molly, and Hermione think the beautiful Fleur is too vain and shallow for the Weasley family, but Fleur shows her mettle when her fiancé, Bill Weasley, is disfigured by werewolf bites.

questions.text: Whom does Ginny Weasley go out with for most of Book 6?
questions.explanation:
Dean Thomas.

	Ginny and Dean are an item until the night that Harry takes a nip of Felix Felicis potion.

questions.text: Why does Ginny call Ron a "filthy hypocrite"?
questions.correct: because he gets mad at Ginny for "snogging" and then does it himself
options: because he tells Ginny not to leave the castle and then does it himself
because he tells Ginny not to cheat at Quidditch and then does it himself
because he tells Ginny to help with the housework and then won't help himself
questions.explanation:
because he gets mad at Ginny for "snogging" and then does it himself.

	There's lots of snogging going on this year. Apparently it embarrasses Ron to see his little sister smooching in the hallways, but does not embarrass him to do so himself (with Lavender Brown).

questions.text: Ron drinks poisoned wine in Slughorn's office. Whose idea was it to bring poisoned wine into Hogwarts?
questions.explanation:
Draco Malfoy's.

	With the aid of Madam Rosmerta, who's under the Imperius Curse, Malfoy brings poisoned wine into the school, hoping that Professor Slughorn will give the wine to Dumbledore as a gift. Slughorn is in the dark about this, so it is not his fault that he gives Ron poisoned wine to drink.

questions.text: With whom is Ron Weasley NOT romantically involved?
questions.explanation:
Cho Chang.

	Hermione is of course Ron's true love, and their developing relationship is clear from her jealousy of his other relationships in this book.  However, Ron has a fling with Lavender and falls briefly and desperately in love with Romilda due to a love potion concealed in chocolate cauldrons. Cho Chang, Ravenclaw's Quidditch Seeker, is the girl with whom Harry has a brief, unsuccessful relationship in Book 5.

questions.text: For how long has Ginny been infatuated with Harry?
options: since her second year at Hogwarts
since her fourth year at Hogwarts
since the Christmas party in Slughorn's office
questions.explanation:
since she met him.

	Ginny first glimpses Harry in Book 1 when her family is seeing Ron, Percy, and the twins off on the Hogwarts Express. It is Ron and Harry's first year.

questions.text: What position(s) does Ginny play in the Book 6 Quidditch games?
questions.explanation:
Chaser and Seeker.

	She plays Chaser in the first two games and Seeker in the last one. She has to substitute for Harry in the Ravenclaw game because Harry is in detention with Professor Snape. Ginny's triumph in the final game provides the push that Harry needs to kiss her at long last.

questions.text: For the first few years that he knows her, Harry does not seem to pay Ginny much mind. Why does this change in Book 6?
questions.correct: All of these elements cause Harry's feelings to change.
options: When Ginny goes out with other boys, Harry gets jealous.
Ginny has finally begun to act like herself around Harry.
Ginny grows prettier as she grows older.
questions.explanation:
All of these elements cause Harry's feelings to change.

	Hermione--who is usually right--counsels Ginny to get on with her life and be herself around Harry.

questions.text: What causes the rift between Percy Weasley and his family?
questions.correct: Percy's blind loyalty to the Ministry of Magic
options: Percy's refusal to spend Christmas with the Weasleys
Percy's role in Professor Dumbledore's death
questions.explanation:
Percy's blind loyalty to the Ministry of Magic.

	Percy has always been a pompous prig who follows authority figures blindly. In Book 5 he sided with the Ministry against the Order of the Phoenix and in Book 6 he does not seem to have changed.

questions.text: In what order were the Weasley children born?
questions.correct: Bill, Charlie, Percy, the twins, Ron, Ginny
options: Charlie, Percy, Bill, the twins, Ron, Ginny
Percy, Bill, Charlie, the twins, Ron, Ginny
the twins, Ron, Ginny, Percy, Charlie, Bill
questions.explanation:
Bill, Charlie, Percy, the twins, Ron, Ginny.

	By the time Harry starts Hogwarts, Bill and Charlie have already graduated.

questions.text: Where does Ginny's relationship with Harry stand at the end of Book 6?
questions.correct: They are in love but not "together."
options: They break up after a quarrel.
They are engaged to marry after Ginny graduates.
questions.explanation:
They are in love but not "together."

	Harry breaks up with Ginny to protect her from Voldemort. (But I'm thinking that this won't do any good--isn't Voldemort a pretty good mind reader?)

questions.text: How does Molly Weasley show that she is reconciled to the marriage of Bill and Fleur?
questions.correct: by offering Fleur Great-Auntie Muriel's tiara
options: by asking Fleur whether the girl still loves Bill
by agreeing to hold the wedding in Paris
by asking Fleur to apply medication to Bill's wounds
questions.explanation:
by offering Fleur Great-Auntie Muriel's tiara.

	When Fleur shows that Bill's looks do not matter to her, Molly immediately melts toward the French girl and they end up embracing and weeping together.

at Gringott's.

	When Harry needs money for school supplies, Bill brings him a bag of money from boy's vault to save Harry the trouble of waiting in long lines. Due to Voldemort's reappearance, there is heightened security at the goblin-run bank.
